The in-game tool-tips are not very helpful either in some cases and, again, going back to the screen size, the font is very small and I can imagine would be very tiny on a smaller screen. All that to say, I have over 10 hours into this game so far and I believe I have had it less than a week. It is a 2D version of Factorio without the drama of biters or the weaponry that goes along with them. There's also no power requirements (as of this writing) for any of the buildings so that really helps, too. content: This game is awesome! Truly one of the best mobile games out there. And for only $1? Just buy it. The best comparison here is to production line games like Factorio and Mindustry. Factorio is about optimizing layout and factory efficiency on a (very) large scale. Mindustry is a tower defense game which emphasizes production speed and utilizing the terrain effectively. Both of those features (large scale and speed) are difficult to fully experience on a small mobile screen. The Quarry is much better on mobile. It's more a pure production line game. It's a puzzle, not an optimization game or a tower defense game. And it is terribly fun. The tech tree here is very deep, and I really like how the tutorial gives you just enough to get started and you get to figure out how everything works for yourself. It is just a joy to play, and because it's a puzzle, there's no rush. It works really well on a small screen (though I will probably purchase the Steam version to support the developer since this gem is worth far more than $1.) tl;dr: If you like Factorio, Mindustry, Satisfactory, Production Line, or any other production game, buy this immediately. If you are looking for a different kind of puzzly game than typical mobile fare, buy this game. If I could give 6 stars I would.
